medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Five days before presentation, the patient was found conscious on his bed room floor with new generalized weakness and unsteadiness. He was unable to walk with a walker. His symptoms progressed over these five days, with increasing pancytopenia and worsening renal function, as evidenced by an increase in creatinine level from a baseline of 2.4 mg/dL to 3.2 mg/dL.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Benign prostatic hypertrophy, chronic kidney disease, normal pressure hydrocephalus, mild dementia, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and coronary artery disease. He had multivessel coronary-artery bypass grafting 14 years prior and placement of drug-eluting coronary stents 11 months prior. Treated for Lyme disease 3 years before evaluation.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had heart disease; father had dementia.
medical_history.social_history: Widower living in a house with his son, daughter-in-law, and grandson, without pets. Previously worked as a home inspector; enjoys reading and spending time outside. Does not use alcohol, tobacco, or illicit drugs.
